alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Blount; Knox (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 16 at 5:44PM CDT until May 16 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR KNOX...SOUTHEASTERN ANDERSON AND NORTH CENTRAL BLOUNT COUNTIES... At 643 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Knoxville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Clinton, Alcoa, Farragut, Louisville, Rockford, Eagleton Village, Halls and Karns. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 in Tennessee between mile markers 374 and 400. Interstate 75 in Tennessee between mile markers 108 and 117. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
